author: Migrations to Solitude
text: weren't we just speaking about what we aint got now that we did haz then?? https://t.co/8eQMGstLeG

author: Migrations to Solitude
text: maybe this #student is an #Absurdist?  I mean, how else can you come to school for several months and get DUMBER??  I mean, WTF-- you went from a 2nd grade DOWN to a 1st grade reading level?? https://t.co/OJZbHGkOp1

author: Migrations to Solitude
text:
say, here's a random #StrawPoll.  We know that from our childhoods until today there's been tons of changes.  We have all SORTS of stuff now we didn't have then.

but, let's switch th' question 'roundabout-- what (if anything) did we have then that we DON'T HAVE NOW??

author: Migrations to Solitude
text:
random find, I think it's in reflection / response to something in Aziz Ansari's book Modern Romance.

author: Migrations to Solitude
text: I fell down a rabbit hole on how lace is made by hand.  Cuz my Weird Fact of th' Day for Monday is that in th' 1700's French royalty used lace for toilet paper.  Makes sense, but they must have had an ARMY of Royal Tatters to be able to produce enough to keep up...

author: Migrations to Solitude
text:
some kind soul has digitized #Maus by Art Spiegelman  for all them folk who are having to wait for a hardcopy...

download it quick afore someone comes along and removes that, too....

https://t.co/UK5iORZ6Ar
